intro: Moenchia erecta subsp. octandra, commonly known as the eight-lobed moenchia, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its erect growth habit and distinctive inflorescence. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces spikelets with two to three bracts. Its flowers are typically small and inconspicuous, arranged in dense clusters. Moenchia erecta subsp. octandra is often found in moist, disturbed habitats such as wetlands and riverbanks.
